intro: Daphnopsis boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian daphnopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
